intro: Aeschynomene pauciflora, commonly known as the small-flowered sesban, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender stems and small, clustered flowers. Its leaves are trifoliate, and the pods are slender and hairy. It is often found in disturbed soils and is used in some traditional medicinal practices.
